abstract: AOL will move its headquarters from Dulles, Va., next spring as it tries to retool itself as an advertising company that competes with the likes of Google, Yahoo and Microsoft.
snippet: AOL will move its headquarters from Dulles, Va., next spring as it tries to retool itself as an advertising company that competes with the likes of Google, Yahoo and Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: IT’S not a literal move to Madison Avenue, but it’s close.

headline.main: Moving Downtown: AOL Seeks New Image
headline.print_headline: Moving Downtown: AOL Seeks New Image

abstract: The move comes two years to the day after The New York Times began the subscription program, TimesSelect.
snippet: The move comes two years to the day after The New York Times began the subscription program, TimesSelect.
lead_paragraph: The New York Times will stop charging for access to parts of its Web site, effective at midnight tonight.

headline.main: Times to Stop Charging for Parts of Its Web Site
headline.print_headline: Times to Stop Charging for Parts of Its Web Site

abstract: The company said that its new product would establish a cellphone advertising network in which Google would match ads with the content of mobile Web pages.
snippet: The company said that its new product would establish a cellphone advertising network in which Google would match ads with the content of mobile Web pages.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 17  In another step to extend its dominance of online advertising, Google said Monday that it would begin selling ads on Web pages that are viewed on cellphones.

headline.main: Google to Sell Web-Page Ads Visible on Mobile Phones
headline.print_headline: Google to Sell Web-Page Ads Visible on Mobile Phones

abstract: The deal, for $350 million in cash and stock, is the second sizable acquisition Yahoo has announced this month.
snippet: The deal, for $350 million in cash and stock, is the second sizable acquisition Yahoo has announced this month.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo said yesterday that it was buying Zimbra, a start-up that provides Web-based e-mail to businesses and institutions, as it seeks to extend the reach of its popular e-mail service and better compete with Google.

headline.main: Yahoo Buying Zimbra, an E-Mail Service for Businesses
headline.print_headline: Yahoo Buying Zimbra, an E-Mail Service for Businesses

abstract: Yahoo said Monday that it was buying Zimbra, a start-up that provides Web-based e-mail to businesses and institutions, as it seeks to extend the reach of its popular e-mail service and better compete with Google.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo said Monday that it was buying Zimbra, a start-up that provides Web-based e-mail to businesses and institutions, as it seeks to extend the reach of its popular e-mail service and better compete with Google.

headline.main: Yahoo to Buy Business E-Mail Service
